semantic_title: Coding Retained Products of Conception Following Abortion
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 15. Chapter 15: Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperium > q. Termination of Pregnancy and Spontaneous abortions > 2) Retained Products of Conception following an abortion

content.full_text: Subsequent encounters for retained products of conception following a spontaneous abortion or elective termination of pregnancy, without complications are assigned O03.4, Incomplete spontaneous abortion without complication, or code O07.4, Failed attempted termination of pregnancy without complication. This advice is appropriate even when the patient was discharged previously with a discharge diagnosis of complete abortion. If the patient has a specific complication associated with the spontaneous abortion or elective termination of pregnancy in addition to retained products of conception, assign the appropriate complication code (e.g., O03.-, O04.-, O07.-) instead of code O03.4 or O07.4. (Evidence: pg no: 70, L45-L50)
content.summary: Subsequent encounters for retained products of conception use O03.4 or O07.4 unless complications are present, then use appropriate complication codes. (Evidence: pg no: 70, L45-L50)
key_concepts: Retained products of conception (Evidence: pg no: 70, L45)
Complication-based code selection (Evidence: pg no: 70, L49-L50)
Override of previous complete abortion diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 70, L48-L49)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use O03.4 or O07.4 for retained products without complications (Evidence: pg no: 70, L46-L48)
detailed_rules.explanation: When retained products of conception are found on subsequent encounters without additional complications, use the incomplete abortion codes even if previously coded as complete (Evidence: pg no: 70, L46-L49)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use appropriate complication codes when complications are present with retained products (Evidence: pg no: 70, L49-L50)
detailed_rules.explanation: If the patient has specific complications in addition to retained products, use the complication-specific codes from O03.-, O04.-, or O07.- instead of the basic incomplete codes (Evidence: pg no: 70, L49-L50)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify retained products of conception
Step 2: Determine if complications are present
Step 3: If no complications, use O03.4 or O07.4
Step 4: If complications present, use appropriate complication code

code_ranges.description: Spontaneous abortion codes with complications (Evidence: pg no: 70, L50)
code_ranges.requirement: Use when complications present with retained products
usage_rules: Select specific complication code when complications exist (Evidence: pg no: 70, L49-L50)

code_ranges.description: Medical abortion codes with complications (Evidence: pg no: 70, L50)
code_ranges.requirement: Use when complications present with retained products
usage_rules: Select specific complication code when complications exist (Evidence: pg no: 70, L49-L50)

code_ranges.description: Failed attempted termination codes with complications (Evidence: pg no: 70, L50)
code_ranges.requirement: Use when complications present with retained products
usage_rules: Select specific complication code when complications exist (Evidence: pg no: 70, L49-L50)

specific_codes.description: Incomplete spontaneous abortion without complication (Evidence: pg no: 70, L47-L48)
specific_codes.context: Subsequent encounters for retained products after spontaneous abortion without complications

specific_codes.description: Failed attempted termination of pregnancy without complication (Evidence: pg no: 70, L48-L49)
specific_codes.context: Subsequent encounters for retained products after elective termination without complications

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient returns 2 weeks after abortion with ultrasound showing retained products, no other complications
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient had complete abortion 2 weeks ago. Ultrasound today shows retained products of conception. No bleeding, infection, or other complications noted.
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify retained products of conception
Step 3: Determine type of original abortion
Step 4: Code O03.4 for spontaneous or O07.4 for elective

correct_coding.sequencing: Single code based on abortion type
correct_coding.rationale: Retained products without complications use incomplete abortion codes even if previously coded as complete (Evidence: pg no: 70, L46-L49)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Must change to incomplete when retained products found
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Not updating diagnosis when retained products discovered

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient returns after abortion with retained products and infection
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient presents with retained products of conception and endometritis following elective termination.
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify retained products of conception
Step 4: Use O07.- with infection code, not O07.4

correct_coding.rationale: When complications are present with retained products, use complication codes instead of O03.4 or O07.4 (Evidence: pg no: 70, L49-L50)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should use integrated complication code, not separate codes
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using basic incomplete code when complications are present

warnings: Can override previous complete abortion diagnosis when retained products found (Evidence: pg no: 70, L48-L49)
best_practices: Use complication-specific codes when complications are present (Evidence: pg no: 70, L49-L50)
common_mistakes: Not changing from complete to incomplete when retained products discovered
Using basic incomplete codes when complications are present
tips: Always assess for complications when coding retained products
implementation_notes: Allows for accurate coding of subsequent findings regardless of initial diagnosis
clinical_context: Common in follow-up care after abortion procedures
